business.headline: ITC set to report Q4 results today: Earnings, dividend payout in focusSo far this financial year, the diversified FMCG and cigarette giant has already handed out an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share. Given its track record, investors are now eyeing another generous payout.

Explained: Why bitcoin has hit a fresh all-time high The world's most valuable cryptocurrency has gained over 50% since April, propelled by improving global risk appetite and a flight to alternatives as doubts over the US dollar's stability grow.

Government notice to Uber over advance tipping, Union Minister calls it 'unethical'The Consumer Protection Body has issued a notice to Uber regarding its practice of collecting advanced tips from users. Union Minister Prahlad Joshi has termed the practice 'deeply concerning', 'unethical and exploitative'. Uber has been given 15 days to respond to the notice. The government is widening its crackdown on practices violating consumer protection norms, with Rapido potentially facing a probe as well.

Foxconn building dorms at 300-acre iPhone campus in India: ReportThe dorms are part of the company's plan to support numerous workers at its plant, which is expected to play a major role in Apple's growing operations in India.

Sensex plunges 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?At around 9:34 am, the BSE Sensex was down 850.70 points at 80,745.93, while the NSE Nifty50 slumped 262.15 points to 24,551.30. Market volatility spiked, dragging down broader indices and putting pressure on small- and mid-cap stocks.

IndusInd Bank shares in focus after Q4 loss amid fraud. Buy, hold or sell?The private lender reported a net loss of Rs 2,236 crore for the fourth quarter, a sharp reversal from a profit of Rs 2,347 crore in the same period last year. This marks a pivotal moment for the bank, which has now admitted that certain employees may have engaged in fraudulent activity that impacted its financial reporting.
Sensex, Nifty tank as IT stocks bleed over US deficit fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 753.42 points to 80,843.21, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 209.65 points to 209.65 as of 9:27 am.

Stocks to watch on May 22: ITC, IndusInd Bank, IndiGo, Sun Pharma, RVNLSeveral companies are set to announce their January–March quarter (Q4) earnings today, such as ITC, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, Grasim Industries, Honasa Consumer, etc.

IndiGo CEO responds to Turkish lease concerns: 'Operations fully compliant'There has been rising attention to IndiGo's ties with Turkish Airlines amid reports that the Indian government may not extend the leasing agreement, which is due to end on May 31.
Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue their rally?After heavy selling in earlier sessions, FPIs turned net buyers and purchased shares worth Rs 2,201.79 corer in the last session.
IndusInd Bank posts first loss in nearly 2 decades, flags employee fraudIndusInd Bank said its Q4 numbers reflect the impact of all the discrepancies identified so far through ongoing investigations.

After Uber, government likely to probe Rapido over advance tips for rideThe government crackdown on ride-hailing apps urging advance tipping may soon widen. After Uber, Rapido could be next in line for a probe over the controversial feature.

entertainment.headline: Adito Rao Hydari's sindoor-red saree look at Cannes 'melts' husband SiddharthAs Aditi Rao Hydari dazzled at the Cannes Film Festival as a newlywed in a stunning red saree and 'sindoor', her husband, actor Siddharth, couldn't stop gushing over her.

Miley Cyrus recalls 'traumatic' health scare that nearly made her quit musicSinger and actor Miley Cyrus opened up about a painful ovarian cyst rupture in 2023 that nearly made her quit music. Describing the experience as traumatic and excruciating, she shared how difficult it was for her to cope.

Karan Johar says Ishaan Khatter is 'national crush' after The RoyalsKaran Johar and Ishaan Khatter, along with the 'Homebound' team, are at Cannes for the film's screening. Amid all the appreciation that the film received, KJo praised Ishaan and his acting skills.

KJo recalls meeting Leonardo DiCaprio, Martin Scorcese: My knees started rattlingAt the Cannes Film Festival, filmmaker Karan Johar recalled a past encounter with Leonardo DiCaprio and Martin Scorsese. He credited Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan as his lucky charm.

Elle Fanning's Sentimental Value wows Cannes with 15-minute standing ovation'Sentimental Value', starring Elle Fanning and Stellan Skarsgard, received the longest-standing ovation at the 78th Cannes Film Festival, earning a rousing 15-minute applause following its premiere on May 21.

Dhanush is APJ Abdul Kalam in Om Raut-directed biopic, film launched at CannesActor Dhanush will play 'Missile Man of India' and former President of India, Dr APJ Abdul Kalam, in his biography, directed by Om Raut. The film was launched at the 78th Cannes Film Festival.
Salman Khan to return with Bigg Boss 19 in July: ReportSalman Khan-hosted 'Bigg Boss 19' is reportedly set to return in July. As per reports, the actor will shoot for the promo at the end of June.

Dhadkan and its silent misogyny: Why Anjali lived a flawed fairytale of endurance'Dhadkan' is often seen as a classic love triangle, but below the surface, it tells a troubling story of a woman forced to make a choice from options available to her by patriarchy. The film glorifies sacrifice and sends a dangerous message about what it means to be a 'good woman' in love.

Rana Naidu Season 2: Rana Daggubati's gritty actioner set for June releaseThe release date of Rana Daggubati and Venkatesh's 'Rana Naidu Season 2' has been announced. The makers shared the announcement with a fresh new promo on May 21.

Kapil Sharma's show's team mourns photographer Krishna Das's death: He was familyComedian Kiku Sharda and the team of Kapil Sharma's show expressed grief after the death of photographer Krishna Das. The team released an emotional statement. Dada, who was seen interacting with celebrities in The Kapil Sharma Show.

Zootopia 2 trailer: Nick and Judy reunite for a new case, Disney unveils fresh facesDisney has dropped the first 'Zootopia 2' trailer, reuniting the iconic duo with a fresh squad. Stealing the spotlight is Gary De'Snake, a hilarious new pit viper character.

Homebound team gets emotional as it receives 9-minute standing ovation at CannesNeeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' received a heartwarming 9-minute standing ovation at the Cannes Film Festival 2025, leaving the cast and crew emotional. The only Indian feature at Cannes this year, the film has been praised for its powerful storytelling and performances.

Actor Ravi Mohan's wife Aarti files petition seeking Rs 40 lakh monthly alimonyRavi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti, has demanded a hefty alimony of Rs 40 lakh per month in their ongoing divorce case. The couple appeared before the Chennai Family Court, where both filed their respective petitions.

Mohanlal unveils Vrusshabha first look, back in warrior-king modeActor Mohanlal unveiled the first look of his upcoming magnum opus 'Vrusshabha' on his 65th birthday. The actor also shared a personal message for fans revealing the release date of the film.

Why there's no Hera Pheri without Paresh Rawal's Baburao Ganpatrao ApteParesh Rawal's portrayal of Baburao Ganpatrao Apte aka Babu Bhaiya in the 'Hera Pheri' franchise is considered one of his best performances. What makes it one of the most iconic cinematic portrayals in Hindi cinema? Why can nobody replace Rawal as Baburao? A glimpse at how the actor is an inevitable force of the 'Hera Pheri' franchise.

Maranamass director discusses crafting unconventional dark comedy with Basil JosephMalayalam director Sivaprasad made a striking commercial debut with 'Maranamass', a dark comedy thriller that brings a fresh and experimental flavour to the industry. In an interview with us, he talked about how the film blends humour with unconventional storytelling to offer a unique cinematic experience.

Campus Beats creator on K-dramas' popularity in India: We have nothing for youthCampus Beats, a dance-based fiction show created by Palki Malhotra, has resonated deeply with young Indian audiences by addressing their relatable experiences and emotions. The show's success highlights a gap in Indian youth content, especially when compared to the popularity of Korean dramas during the OTT boom.

Ex-Pentagon member Kino wants to collaborate with W.i.S.H. Girl band reactsSouth Korean artist Kino expressed his desire to collaborate with Indian girl band W.i.S.H, sparking excitement among the group. The band members feel thrilled that their music has reached South Korea and are eager for future global collaborations.

Pawan Kalyan gets objectionable item song lyrics changed in Hari Hara Veera MalluAhead of the release of 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1 – Sword vs Spirit', music director MM Keeravani revealed that Pawan Kalyan had the item song lyrics rewritten to avoid objectification.

general news.headline: Pak leadership, Army chief, driven by extreme religious outlook: S JaishankarPak leadership, especially the Army chief, is driven by extreme religious outlook: Jaishankar to Dutch channel

2 Israeli Embassy staffers killed in Washington, suspect shouted 'Free Palestine'The US Homeland Security Secretary announced the death of staffers in a post on X, which took place near the FBI's field office.

Video: Get out of here, Trump snaps at reporter who asked about Qatar jetTrump clashed with an NBC reporter over questions about a Qatari jet gifted to the US Air Force, accusing the network of diverting attention from violence against white farmers in South Africa.

Army chief puts Yunus on notice: What it means for a beleaguered BangladeshOn Wednesday, in a Durbar bringing together "all available officers in combat uniform" at Dhaka's Senaprangan, General Waker declared that the interim government will have to hold national elections by December this year.
Aishwarya Rai's sindoor statement on and off Cannes red carpetAishwarya Rai Bachchan returned to Cannes red carpet, clad in an elegant ivory saree by designer Manish Malhotra.

How the Golden Temple defied invaders from the northThe Golden Temple hit the headlines after an Army official hinted that air defence guns were deployed in its premises to neutralise aerial threats from Pakistan. However, the Army has denied any such move. In this edition of The Lowdown, we turn back the pages to recall how the Harmandar Sahib, a citadel of faith, has been targeted by invaders who desecrated and destroyed it.

IndiGo CEO responds to Turkish lease concerns: 'Operations fully compliant'There has been rising attention to IndiGo's ties with Turkish Airlines amid reports that the Indian government may not extend the leasing agreement, which is due to end on May 31.

Video: US tests Minuteman III nuclear-capable missile that can strike anywhereIn a show of force, the US launched an unarmed Minuteman III intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) -- capable of carrying nuclear warheads and targeting locations anywhere in the world -- from the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, as part of the country's regular doomsday missile tests.

Janhvi Kapoor embraces vintage elegance in black outfit at Cannes. PicsJanhvi Kapoor highlighted vintage elegance at Cannes with her third outfit. The actor looked breathtaking in black dress by Christian Dior.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Nepali spy, sleeper cells: Pak ISI's big terror plot before Pahalgam attackDuring the arrest, investigators recovered classified documents and incriminating digital evidence from Nepali-origin ISI agent, Ansarul Mian Ansari. A forensic analysis confirmed these to be confidential military files.
Hamas chief Mohammed Sinwar likely killed in Gaza airstrike, says NetanyahuIsraeli PM Netanyahu said Hamas leader Mohammed Sinwar was 'probably' killed in Gaza.

Hardik Pandya never gives up, good to see his turnaround in IPL 2025: Ajay JadejaIPL 2025: Hardik Pandya soaked in the applause from the Mumbai crowd when he led the lap of honour at the Wankhede Stadium after Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals on Wednesday to secure their spot in the playoffs.

Sensex plunges 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?At around 9:34 am, the BSE Sensex was down 850.70 points at 80,745.93, while the NSE Nifty50 slumped 262.15 points to 24,551.30. Market volatility spiked, dragging down broader indices and putting pressure on small- and mid-cap stocks.

Trump takes credit for everything: Ex-aide on India-Pak ceasefire claimFormer US NSA John Bolton dismissed Trump's claim of mediating peace between India and Pakistan, saying he "takes credit for everything." He called it typical behaviour, adding it's "nothing against India, it's just Trump being Trump".
Terrorists trapped as gunfight breaks out with security forces in J&K's KishtwarAs per initial reports, security forces have successfully trapped 3-4 terrorists in the Singhpora area of Chatroo.

Galaxy Z Flip 7 tipped to be Samsung's first foldable with this chipsetA new rumour has surfaced claiming that the upcoming Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 will finally debut with an Exynos chipset, the first time in the Galaxy Z series.

3,000 Agniveers braved Pak assault in Operation Sindoor, guarded key installationsFrom manning critical air defence systems to holding their ground across multiple installations, cities, and airbases despite repeated enemy assaults, the Agniveers' performance matched that of regular soldiers.

Who's the next BJP chief? Naddaji, Khargeji, Kya farak padta jiThe answer to the question — who's the next BJP chief — is a question — does it really matter? The party president's post in both the BJP and the Congress comes with great responsibilities, and little power. In the BJP, the party chief is in the driving seat of a Tesla Autopilot, steered remotely. But at least, its present and future are safe.

Panic, cries as IndiGo flight hits turbulence, lands in Srinagar with broken noseAn IndiGo flight 6E2142 encountered severe hailstorm turbulence while approaching Srinagar, damaging the aircraft's nose cone while attempting to land. All passengers and crew members were evacuated safely upon landing.

Dhadkan and its silent misogyny: Why Anjali lived a flawed fairytale of endurance'Dhadkan' is often seen as a classic love triangle, but below the surface, it tells a troubling story of a woman forced to make a choice from options available to her by patriarchy. The film glorifies sacrifice and sends a dangerous message about what it means to be a 'good woman' in love.

Don't have a plane to give you: South African President's witty jab at TrumpSouth African President Cyril Ramaphosa met Donald Trump at the White House. He joked about not having a plane to give, while Trump argued with a reporter and showed a video about white farmers, which Ramaphosa calmly responded to.

Amorim to quit United without payoff if board loses trust after Europa lossRuben Amorim vowed to leave Manchester United without compensation if the board loses faith, following their Europa League final defeat and a disappointing season that has put his future at the club in serious doubt.

Maoist Basavaraju killed: How 50-hour-long Op Kagar ended era of red terrorMaoist General Secretary Nambala Keshava Rao, aka Basavaraju, was killed in a 50-hour operation in Chhattisgarh's Abujhmad forests, dealing a major blow to the CPI (Maoist) leadership and network.

sports.headline: Manchester United Collapse: A Nightmare season ends without glory or europeManchester United's Europa League final loss captured the very essence of their horror 2024-25 season. A campaign filled with missteps, a misfiring forward line and a lack of mentality has seen the Red Devils set for their worst finish in the Premier League and miss out on making it to Europe for the next season.

Hardik Pandya never gives up, good to see his turnaround in IPL 2025: Ajay JadejaIPL 2025: Hardik Pandya soaked in the applause from the Mumbai crowd when he led the lap of honour at the Wankhede Stadium after Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals on Wednesday to secure their spot in the playoffs.

Amorim to quit United without payoff if board loses trust after Europa lossRuben Amorim vowed to leave Manchester United without compensation if the board loses faith, following their Europa League final defeat and a disappointing season that has put his future at the club in serious doubt.

IPL 2025: DC head coach rues missed yorkers, Axar Patel absence in MI lossHemang Badani lamented Delhi's failure to execute yorkers and the absence of Axar Patel after their 59-run loss to Mumbai Indians ended their IPL 2025 playoff hopes and exposed gaps in their bowling depth.

Tottenham Hotspurs captain Son Heung-min accepts legend tag after Europa winSon Heung-min finally called himself a Spurs legend after captaining Tottenham to their first European trophy — a historic Europa League win over Manchester United that ended a 17-year wait and booked a Champions League return.

How Pollard is turning Naman Dhir into Mumbai Indians' designated finisherIPL 2025, MI vs DC: Mumbai Indians batter Naman Dhir credited his rising success as a finisher to the consistent guidance of his side's batting coach, Kieron Pollard, along with his captain Hardik Pandya.

How Mumbai Indians can finish in top two after sealing their berth in playoffsHaving sealed their berth in the playoffs with a thumping win over Delhi Capitals (DC), Mumbai Indians (MI) can also finish in top two to have two chances to make it to the final.

Tottenham end 17-year wait with Europa League title win over Manchester UnitedBrennan Johnson's goal proved to be the difference as Tottenham Hotspur ended a 17-year trophy drought to beat Manchester United to win the Europa League.

Bangladesh slip to new low, lose T20I series to UAE for first timeBangladesh succumbed to a 2-1 series defeat against the United Arab Emirates, marking the first time the Tigers have lost a T20I series to the Associate nation. The UAE chased down a 163-run target with seven wickets in hand and five balls to spare to script a memorable win in the series decider.

Watch: Nita Ambani's No. 6 celebration goes viral after MI reach IPL playoffsIPL 2025 MI vs DC: Following Mumbai Indians' commanding 59-run win over Delhi Capitals on Wednesday, owner Nita Ambani was seen holding up six fingers, telling the world that the five-time champions are coming for the big prize. MI became the fourth and final team to qualify for the playoffs.

Suryakumar recalls wife's sweet story after ending wait for POTM awardIPL 2025, MI vs DC: Suryakumar Yadav dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife after his match-winning 73-run knock helped Mumbai Indians hammer Delhi Capitals by 59 runs to book a place in the playoffs.

How Mumbai Indians can finish in top two after sealing their berth in playoffsHaving sealed their berth in the playoffs with a thumping win over Delhi Capitals (DC), Mumbai Indians (MI) can also finish in top two to have two chances to make it to the final.

Tottenham end 17-year wait with Europa League title win over Manchester UnitedBrennan Johnson's goal proved to be the difference as Tottenham Hotspur ended a 17-year trophy drought to beat Manchester United to win the Europa League.

The UAE chased down a 163-run target with seven wickets in hand and five balls to spare to script a memorable win in the series decider.

MI became the fourth and final team to qualify for the playoffs.

Suryakumar recalls wife's sweet story after ending wait for POTM awardIPL 2025, MI vs DC: Suryakumar Yadav dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife after his match-winning 73-run knock helped Mumbai Indians hammer Delhi Capitals by 59 runs to book a place in the playoffs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
